org.openmuc.jmbus

Class MBusSap

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openmuc.jmbus.MBusSap

  • public class MBusSap
extends java.lang.Object
    M-Bus Application Layer Service Access Point - Use this access point to communicate using the M-Bus wired protocol.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MBusSap(java.lang.String serialPortName, int baudRate)
      Creates an M-Bus Service Access Point that is used to read meters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MBusSap

        public MBusSap(java.lang.String serialPortName,
       int baudRate)
        Creates an M-Bus Service Access Point that is used to read meters.
        Parameters:
        serialPortName - examples for serial port identifiers are on Linux "/dev/ttyS0" or "/dev/ttyUSB0" and on Windows "COM1"
        baudRate - the baud rate to use.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Opens the serial port. The serial port needs to be opened before attempting to read a device.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any kind of error occurs opening the serial port.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the serial port.

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the maximum time in ms to wait for new data from the remote device.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time in ms to wait for new data. Must be greater then 0.

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Returns the timeout in ms.
        Returns:
        the timeout in ms.

      • read

        public VariableDataStructure read(int primaryAddress)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Reads a meter using primary addressing. Sends a data request (REQ_UD2) to the remote device and returns the variable data structure from the received RSP_UD frame.
        Parameters:
        primaryAddress - the primary address of the meter to read. For secondary address use 0xfd.
        Returns:
        the variable data structure from the received RSP_UD frame
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any kind of error (including timeout) occurs while trying to read the remote device. Note that the connection is not closed when an IOException is thrown.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if no response at all (not even a single byte) was received from the meter within the timeout span.

      • write

        public boolean write(int primaryAddress,
            byte[] data)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Writes to a meter using primary addressing. Sends a data send (SND_UD) to the remote device and returns a true if slave sends a 0x7e else false
        Parameters:
        primaryAddress - the primary address of the meter to write. For secondary address use 0xfd.
        data - the data to sends to the meter.
        Returns:
        true if data could be sent else false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any kind of error (including timeout) occurs while trying to read the remote device. Note that the connection is not closed when an IOException is thrown.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if no response at all (not even a single byte) was received from the meter within the timeout span.

      • scanSelection

        public boolean scanSelection(SecondaryAddress wildcard)
        [alpha]
        Scans if any device response to the given wildcard.
        Parameters:
        wildcard - secondary address wildcard e.g. f1ffffffffffffff
        Returns:
        true ifany device responsed else false

      • selectComponent

        public void selectComponent(SecondaryAddress secondaryAddress)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Selects the meter with the specified secondary address. After this the meter can be read on primary address 0xfd.
        Parameters:
        secondaryAddress - the secondary address of the meter to select.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any kind of error (including timeout) occurs while trying to read the remote device. Note that the connection is not closed when an IOException is thrown.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if no response at all (not even a single byte) was received from the meter within the timeout span.

      • deselectComponent

        public void deselectComponent()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Deselects the previously selected meter.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any kind of error (including timeout) occurs while trying to read the remote device. Note that the connection is not closed when an IOException is thrown.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if no response at all (not even a single byte) was received from the meter within the timeout span.

      • linkReset

        public void linkReset(int primaryAddress)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Sends a SND_NKE message to reset the FCB (frame counter bit).
        Parameters:
        primaryAddress - the primary address of the meter to reset.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during the reset process.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if the slave does not answer with an 0xe5 message within the configured timeout span.
